alert.note: Alert for New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 12:09PM EST until further notice by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...River and small stream flooding caused by recent excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following county, New Haven. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1208 PM EST, The Quinnipiac River at Wallingford reported a stage of 10.27 ft, which is in minor flooding. Minor flooding is expected to continue this afternoon. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Meetinghouse Brook, Muddy River, Allen Brook and Quinnipiac River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
